Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Merrimac54
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel was great value for our discounted rate. We were happy that our 6 yr old daughter could share a double room at no extra cost. The rooms although not spacious had a big bed and were well laid out. The bathroom was good too. My only comment is that the bathroom fittings were a bit broken (shower door and shower hed and hair drier) but I did not ask for them to be fixed as it wasn't really a problem. Very friendly woman looking after the breakfast room! Superb location

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel & Location if Price is Right”
Reviews.Author: GNCSI
Reviews.Content: We went for this Hotel due to an offer they had for our dates & the fact that it was opened only a year ago. Rooms were clean and comfortable, Staff were helpful & courteous, Breakfast was adequate & wireless was free. If you are looking for a large room with a view...this is not a hotel for you, however if you are looking for a centrally located Hotel, that is close to the Metro, Shopping center & Vatican The Excel fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: Christina T
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location- next to the Vatican city and with all transportation in five minute walk - a very good breakfast with all you need to start your day. We had a little problem with our a room so we requested another room and the staff immediately solved the problem with a smile on their faces.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LarsTorrevieja
Reviews.Content: Nice and helpful staff, good breakfast and good beds.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Brian C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a three night stay at the 3 star Hotel Excel Rome San Pietro. The hotel is located about one block from Piazza Risorgimento and under 10 minutes from St.Peters Square. Wonderful hotel, excellent staff, bright modern spotless rooms and a fantastic breakfast. The location is perfect for a 3 or 4 night break. We would thoroughly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “good enough if the price is right”
Reviews.Author: zaloupa
Reviews.Content: the area is very good, 5 min from vatican city and 15min by foot for the centre of the town.. also you have near to you bus station and metro!!! the employees were very polite and helpfull and all of them spoke english. the breakfast was a little poor and had few things to eat.. the rooms were renovationed and very beautifull, nice bed, good tv, big enough for a couple.. the bathroom was great, everything new in it and in good size. if it wasnt the renovation we wouldnt talk about it now, but it worth the money!!! (i had an offer for the period i went about at 70 euro per day!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: p6403240
Reviews.Content: Really nice litle hotel, with great location (300m.to metro, 600m. to Basilica di San Pietro). It is located within an apartment building. Just like everyone else has said, don't judge the hotel by the appearance of the outside building. It's quite pleasant and modern on the inside.Very helpful,friendly staff. The room was very clean and comfortable, with an electric kettle and cups for making tea or coffee.We didn't have any view from our room (109) but it was very quiet.. WiFi Is free and we had a good connection in our room. The breakfast was very good (without hot meals, but we didn`t need). Just, I think, a little bit overpriced... But it is Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: pilot16
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Excel St Peter's after a series of mistakes by another hotel nearby. Our trip to Italy was centered around a week in Tuscany. To end our trip, we planned three nights in Rome, and for those nights we reserved rooms at the Fabio Massimo Hotel. When by chance we checked email in Tuscany we found a message from Fabio that they had cancelled our reservations in error, and they offered to find us rooms at a similar hotel (the Excel). Here they made another error, for we got to Excel St Peter's only to learn that our reservations there were for one night only. The man on duty very calmly got to the heart of the problem, and invited us to enjoy orange juice and pastries while he arranged for yet another hotel for two nights, until they had a room available., So it was only our final night in Rome that we actually stated at the Excel. We were most appreciative of their professionalism and courtesy. And - the breakfast is wondeful. We loved, in Tuscany, strolling down to the piazza for cappacino and pastry each morning, but we eventually missed the healthier breakfast we are used to, so to find at the Excel St Peters fresh fruit and yogurt and granola-type cereal (in additon, of course, to the usual deadly delicious Italian treats) was a real treat.

Reviews.Title: “close to vatican!”
Reviews.Author: Eranda_11
Reviews.Content: superb location! close to metro & vatican. would not hesitate to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: makusu
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because it was close to the metro and close to the vatican. we read the reviews on trip advisor and booking,com and it was spot on. great location! its about 500m from the metro. about 5-10mins walk from the vatican and castle st angelo. really nice area to stay. close to some nice cafes and some nice shopping too. Great hotel - its new. the room was spacious. bed was comfy. the bathroom was big relative to other hotels we stayed in Italy. breakfast was good. service was excellent. we booked for 2 nights through the internet and then we wanted to stay an extra night, the hotel was nice enough to give us the same rate for that extra night that we had booked on the net. English speaking staff. very helpful in giving us instructions to where we wanted to go. Wifi is free! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great for short stay!”
Reviews.Author: Shannie2
Reviews.Content: Staff were helpful and spoke very good English. Buffet breakfast had limited choices, but food was fresh and lattes were excellent! Rooms were very clean, modern and quiet. Location was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for seeing the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: simofamm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only 3 blocks for the Vatican. It's hard to get much closer. The rates were fare. All the modern amenities are available. The mattress was NOT memory foam as advertised. There was NO pool (also advertised). The room was small (but most rooms in Rome are). My room had a window that opened on to a courtyard (lovely). My fathers room did not have a window and it felt very tiny! (they were 3 in a room and could barely move). Breakfast was good (the usual Italy fare). the staff helpful and courteous. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance and the Metro is only a few blocks away. CONVENIENT.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Love2TravelDoU
Reviews.Content: My husband and I originally had plans to stay at another hotel in Rome...but after reading the reviews for that place...we started searching and lucked upon Excel Hotel. Just like everyone else has said, don't judge the hotel by the appearance of the outside building. It's quite pleasant and modern on the inside. Our room was very small (room 126)!! If you can avoid this room, do so. It's the size of some people's closets. My husband and I didn't complain because we weren't there to enjoy the room, we were there to enjoy the sites of Rome; but if you are a person that needs your space, then avoid that room (plus the view outside the window is bad too). But the room itself was clean. Nice wood floors, tv, eco-friendly. The bed was not too comfy. The bathroom was nice and an added bonus for Americans...there is a 110 outlet in the bathroom!! This was a God-sent because for some odd reason our outlet converter and transformer wouldn't work with our camera charger, but my husband found the outlet in the bathroom so we could charge our camera. Problem solved. Thank you Hotel Excel!! There was free Internet as well (which is a plus). We didn't eat the breakfast at the hotel, though it was included with our room stay. The staff were very nice. Whenever we needed directions some place or a suggestion for a nice restaurant, they were more than willing to help. It's proximity to the Vatican can't be beat (about a 5 minute walk). And my husband and I walked from the hotel to the Coliseum, about a 40 minute walk...we love to walk. Rome is definitely a walkable city, so bring your walking shoes. Also the hotel has lots of little cafes close by and ladies, tons of little boutiques and stores for shopping! If you don't want to walk to the Coliseum or other historic sites the metro station is two blocks away. Overall, good experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Handy to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: aussgirl
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel all on the 1st floor of an apartment block. The rooms were comfortable and a good size. A basic breakfast and internet were included in the rate. We spent two nights here before moving to an apartment. The hotel is very close to the Vatican so we visited this while staying here. There are also quite a few restuarants nearby. Staff were helpful. The only negative was the airport pick up arranged by the hotel. We had been offered a transfer and advised the hotel that there were 4 people and 4 suitcases. The pick up was about a half an hour late and we had to ring to find out if it was coming. Also the car used was too small and one suitcase had to be nursed which made for an uncomfortable journey. I would recommend arranging your own shuttle service if there are 4 of you. Staff at reception were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Want to visit Vaticano, here is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ecealtan
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very near metro and Vaticano. Rooms are very new, hotel workers are very good. Breakfast is enough.

Reviews.Title: “DON´T JUDGE A BOOK BY IT´S COVER (OR A HOTEL BY IT´S ENTRANCE)”
Reviews.Author: JUSTINE27
Reviews.Content: Very clean, modern hotel in a quiet location just around the corner from St Peter´s Square and the Vatican Museum. The entry to the hotel is "unusual" - you go through an old gate into a grubby lobby of some residential apartments that are located on the upper floors. The entry to the "Excel" is on the ground floor and once through their door it´s clean, modern and with a friendly welcome. All the staff were lovely - I think i counted 4 different receptionists on duty at different times and also 2 girls who service the breakfast bar and various people working on housekeeping - all very pleasant and efficient at their jobs. The room we were in "123" was spacious (even for the 3 of us) with modern fixtures - No view (other than the sky) through the windows/skylights but we were out and about during the day and sleepy at night so this was not a problem. The only thing missing (in my opinion) was tea & coffee making facilities in the rooms. I liked the breakfast and also appreciated the fact that it was available until 1030am - the red orange juice was delicious and the pastries always fresh and the other buffet items were constantly replaced by the busy waitress who also brings hot drinks to your table. All the rooms are located on the 1st floor and there´s a glass floor when you come out of the lift which gave my vertigo a run for it´s money ! I would return again tomorrow !

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Excel St Peter
HotelInfo.Address: Via Catone 34, 00192 Rome, Italy
